assessments.status_rationale: Today’s bullets contain no mention of Waymo announcing or confirming an equity financing round, let alone a single disclosed round of ≥$12B.
No item in today’s news indicates the FCC issued a public notice accepting/docketing any SpaceX 'satellite data center' / orbital data-center application for comment.
No coverage here references CoStar, Third Point/Dan Loeb, a settlement, or any independent director appointment tied to that dispute.
Nothing in the provided bullets reports Kraft Heinz announcing a strategic review involving a breakup/spin or sale of a major ≥$2B net-sales segment/portfolio.
No bullet indicates a House/Senate committee held a hearing explicitly referencing claims that WhatsApp chats “aren’t private” (or equivalent) and discussing end-to-end encryption/privacy assurances.

One bullet notes bitcoin had a 'weekend drop' affecting stock futures, but it does not state whether BTC had a daily close below $70,000 on a major reference index. The threshold/close requirement is not evidenced in the bullets.
No item indicates the Senate Banking Committee held a public hearing for a nominee to be the next Fed Chair (Powell’s successor).

Nothing in today’s bullets suggests NHTSA/USDOT issued a research note, advisory, or guidance explicitly addressing adversarial/prompt-injection-style attacks on road signs/visual cues for ADAS/AV systems.
No bullet references a UK Prime Minister visit to China or a meeting with Xi Jinping in China.
